title: Anderson Family Places
name: Anderson Family Places
description:
A Map by Eba

This map notes locations and photos of interest related to Anderson family history.

properties.name: Anderson residence 1988-89
properties.description: Posted by EbaWe lived in an upstairs apartment in a backlot building here for a year or so right after we moved back to California.

properties.name: Anderson residence 1990-1991
properties.description: Posted by Eba3527 Dartmouth Drive, Santa Rosa, CAWhere we lived for a year or so when son CWA was born.

properties.name: Anderson residence 1991-1996
properties.description: Posted by Eba2432 15th Ave, Greeley, COWhere we lived from 1991 to 1996. Daughter RMA was born when we lived her.

properties.name: Anderson residence 1996-2001
properties.description: Posted by Eba1859 12th Ave, Greeley, COWhere we lived at the end of the 20th century.

properties.name: Anderson residence 2001-current
properties.description: Posted by Eba501 50th Ave, Greeley, COWhere the eba branch of the Anderson family currently lives.

properties.name: CWA birthplace, 1990
properties.description: Posted by EbaWhere our son, C, was born in 1990. Second floor, NW part of the building. A little after noon.

properties.name: Cardinal Newman High School
properties.description: Posted by Eba Where eba went to high school pretending to be a Catholic school boy for four years, grades 9 to 12, from about 1976 to 1980. I wasn\'t Catholic, but most of my friends were!

properties.name: Rincon Valley Elementary School
properties.description: Posted by Eba Where eba attended grades three through six. Had to ride a bus down the hill to school. First on, last off, made for long days. Teachers like Mr. Hillard, Mrs. Beaver, Mrs. Altas and another guy. I won the fifth grade geography bee by knowing where National City, California was.

properties.name: Rincon Valley Junior High School
properties.description: Posted by Eba Where eba attended grades seven through nine around 1974-1976. A very typical suburban California middle school. Can\'t say I have any fond memories, except for the one detention I ever got in my school career -- for laughing too much in math class at John Cardenas.

properties.name: Rincon Valley Little League ball parks
properties.description: Posted by EbaHere is where my major league baseball dreams began and ended. I was an OK fielder, but I couldn\'t through across the infield, and, when I got older, couldn\'t hit a curve. Played five years on these tiny fields for teams like the Peanut League Pirates, the Minor League Yankees and Twins, and the Senior B League Twins. I played freshman year in high school, too, with more memories of failures than successes.

properties.name: Santa Rosa Junior College
properties.description: Posted by EbaWhere eba spend his frosh and soph years of college. Learning. And stuff.

properties.name: Village Elementary School
properties.description: Posted by Eba Where eba attended kindergarten, first grade, and second grade. It was here as a kindergartner in 1968 that I drew the first piece of art I ever saved: a crayon portrait of President-Elect Nixon.

properties.name: eba Childhood Home 1.0
properties.description: Posted by Eba3378 Princeton Drive, Santa Rosa, CAThe house my family lived in when I was born, and where I lived until I was about 7. I moved back into this neighborhood, a few blocks over, right before my son was born about 28 years later.

properties.name: eba Childhood Home 2.0
properties.description: Posted by Eba3210 Piedra Lane, Santa Rosa, CAWhere eba grew up, living here from 1969 (from about age 7) through elementary school, junior high and high school, and a couple of years of college, until around 1982.

properties.name: eba birthplace, 1962
properties.description: Posted by EbaWhere eba was born, around 2:15 a.m. in 1962. Parents almost named him Glenn, after John Glenn, who\'d orbited the earth a few days before. But they didn\'t. -- Looks like the old building where he was born has been replaced by a parking lot. It\'s called Santa Rosa Memorial Hospital: www.santarosamemorial.org
